newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Bank Austria to bid for Creditanstalt.
newsitem.headline: Bank Austria to bid for Creditanstalt.

text.p: Bank Austria, the nation's biggest bank, unveiled an 11th hour bid Wednesday to take over archrival Creditanstalt-Bankverein, a state-owned firm due to be privatised.
Bank Austria said its supervisory board had unanimously approved a bid for the state's 70 percent of Creditanstalt's ordinary voting shares.

It gave no financial details of the offer, which Finance Minister Viktor Klima has said must land on his desk by next Monday. Austrian media, however, have reported that Bank Austria is willing to put up 16 billion schillings ($1.5 billion).

Bank Austria faces one other public bidder for Austria's most traditional bank -- a group of industrialists and finance houses led by insurer EA-Generali and savings bank Die Erste Oesterreichische SparCasse Bank (First Austrian).
